outline:
1. to be dislocated, be alienated
    1. (Qal) to be dislocated, be torn away, be alienated
    2. (Hiphil)
      1. to execute slowly (by exposure or impalation)
      2. to hang
    3. (Hophal) to be executed
kjv_def: be alienated, depart, hang (up), be out of joint.
strongs_def: properly, to sever oneself, i.e. (by implication) to be dislocated; figuratively, to abandon; causatively, to impale (and thus allow to drop to pieces by rotting)
